name: Terminal-Compatible Text Encoding
description: Standard requiring terminal-compatible text encoding (ASCII + ANSI escape sequences)
requirements: All text content must use ASCII characters only
ANSI color escape sequences are permitted
Unicode characters (emojis, symbols) are not allowed
Code comments must use ASCII-only text

validation.explanation: Matches ASCII characters (0-127) and ANSI color escape sequences

documentation: Ensures all text content is compatible with terminal environments and command-line tools. Unicode characters like emojis can cause encoding issues, display problems, and break automated tools. ANSI color escape sequences are allowed for terminal formatting.
